title: Electric potential - electric field between plates

content.question: If the magnitude of the electric field at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the 4 power newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo>Ã—</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math> and the distance between the plates is <math alttext="0.80 millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.80</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>mm</mtext></math>, what is the electrical potential difference between the plates?

choices.label: <math alttext="40 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="62.5 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>62.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="4000 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="6250 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6250</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="40 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
